attributes.action: acknowledging the treaty requirements in international law which render the waging of aggressive war for the purpose of regime change an international crime which  the United Kingdom would have committed had parliament not been informed that there was incontrovertible evidence that the Iraq government under Sadam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction capable of being effective within forty-five minutes against UK bases in Cyprus and elsewhere and had obtained substantial amounts of uranium from africa,  institute an open investigation to demonstrate to the world that no person knowingly and with intent caused such wrong information to be given to parliament and the people of the nation, and that if such intentional misinformants be found their name or names be publicly identified and appropriate proceedings either in the British Courts or in the Internationa Criminal Court be instituted
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: See Hansard Debate 4th June 2004 columns 194 and 195, Hansard 4th Feb 2004 column 77i, written answers 129840 15th September 2003 and most particularly Intelligence and Security Committee Report 13th Sept 2003 C<5972 at paras 52. 58, 71, 78 (especially Defence Secretary's Comments p24) paras 79 83 94. Who removed the bracketed comments?
